meanings.definition: A hairstyle in which the hair is combed up and back from the forehead.
meanings.sent1: She admired the elegant pompadours at the party.
meanings.sent2: The singer sported a stylish pompadour on stage.
meanings.sent3: The pompadours at the event looked like tall waves of hair.
meanings.sent4: Her pompadour was a crown of hair that defied gravity.
meanings.sent5: The pompadours in the fashion show were works of art.

meanings.definition: To style one's hair in a pompadour.
meanings.sent1: He carefully pompadoured his hair before the date.
meanings.sent2: She always pompadours her hair for special occasions.
meanings.sent3: They joked that he could pompadour his hair in his sleep.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to pompadour her hair quickly amazed her friends.
meanings.sent5: Pompadour your hair to stand out in the crowd.

meanings.definition: A person who wears their hair in a pompadour.
meanings.sent1: The pompadour smiled warmly at the compliment.
meanings.sent2: She became known as the office pompadour.
meanings.sent3: The pompadour in the mirror winked mischievously.
meanings.sent4: He was the only pompadour in the group of friends.
meanings.sent5: The famous actor was recognized by his signature pompadour.
